On January 31, two rockets were fired by an unidentified group from the Gaza Strip, landed near Sderot in open field. One rocket landed near Sapir College and started a fire. No injuries were reported.
On January 30, three rockets were launched into southern Israel from the Gaza Strip. Sirens were heard near the Sapir College in Sderot and in Nir Am in the Shaar Hanegev Regional Council.
On January 29, students of the Al Quds University clashed with Israeli soldiers in Jerusalem's Abu Dis neighbourhood. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On January 28, Israeli Settler from the Yitzhar Settlement, set fire to a classroom of a primary school in Aynabus, south of Nablus. Settlers also wrote racist slogans demanding the killing and expulsion of Palestinian citizens from their lands.

On Jan 23, shopkeepers and wholesale dealers of the government fruit and vegetable market staged a demonstration in Kohat city (Kohat, KPK), by blocking University road and burning tyres, against the operation of private fruit and vegetable markets in violation of the court orders. [size=no report]

On Jan 23, demonstrators including students in Basra city blocked roads and shut down schools using burning tires, the violent dispersal by riot police left 1 demonstrator killed, as demonstrators continue their civil disobedience in demonstrations in response to the killing of activists and the passing of the 'Nassriya deadline' given by the demonstrators to the government to meet their demands as well as in support of the popular movement. [size=no report]

On 23 January, a mob of 60-70 people assaulted a security guard and damaged the doors and windows of Government Medical College and Hospital in Aurangabad (Aurangabad, Maharashtra), after learning that a patient of the hospital had passed away. [size=60-70]

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Syrian Arab Air Force
notes: On 23 January, 2020, regime warplanes conducted airstrikes on Khan al-Sabeel with S 8 missiles impacting a school, partially damaging its structure, and furniture. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On 23 January 2020, suspected JNIM or ISGs militants entered a school in the village of Donla (Douenda) and abducted two teachers who reportedly were assaulted or subjected to torture-like methods. The militants seized the teachers' two motorbikes and a third belonging to a mason doing work at the school.

On 23 Jan. 2020 (or around), the Divisional officer of Nyong-et-Mfoumou Division ordered the Gendarmerie forces to beat and detain the principal of a high school in Ayos (Nyong-et-Mfoumou, Centre) after he asked her to hold on for students to complete a test before she could visit their classroom.

assoc_actor_1: NASU: Non-Academic Staff Union; SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities; Labour Group (Nigeria); Teachers (Nigeria)
notes: On 22 January 2020, members of the NASU and SSANU demonstrated over the non-payment of their allowances at the University of Oye-Ekiti (Oye LGA, Ekiti). The demonstrators attacked journalists that covered the event. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2020, students from the University of Juba demonstrated against the University's new policy to refuse students who were in fee arrears from sitting final examinations, vandalising property in the University buldings. The University has indicated that it will be changing its approach. [size=no report]
On Jan 22, at least 4 activists of BCL were injured in a factional clash at Chittagong university (Chittagong) over a previous enmity among leaders. [size=at least 4]

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
actor2: Police Forces of Yemen (2012-) Special Security Forces

Anti-aircraft ammunitions were fired in return, with no report of fatalities nor injuries. *Note that pro-Houthi forces did not claim responsibility for the attack.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Greece); Teachers (Greece); OLME: Greek Federation of Secondary Education State School Teachers; DOE: Primary Teachers Union
actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 21 January, students and teachers supported by OLME and DOE demonstrated in central Athens ahead of the vote of a contentious education bill in Parliament that would allow graduates of private colleges affiliated to foreign universities to apply for positions at Greek schools equating private college qualifications to university degrees. At the end of the demonstration, students remained outside Parliament and clashed with MAT riot police, who responded with tear gas. [size=no report]

On Jan 21, an Afghan student was stabbed to death by a group of four men at Goa University in Taleigao town (North Goa, Goa) in an alleged hate crime incident after an altercation over a motorbike. [size=four]

On 21 January 2020, students from the Nonhlevu Secondary School in Groutville in KwaZulu-Natal burned papers at the school entrance after three teachers, whom the students felt weren't performing, returned to the school. The school governing body and parents joined the demonstration. [size=no report].
On Jan 21, at least 10 activists of BCL were injured in an armed factional clash at Islamic university (Kushtia). There was a longstanding dispute between the presidents of both factions.

On 21 Jan. 2020, a group of students threw stones at their schools and clashed the Gendarmerie forces, as they were demonstrating against the organisation of exams without the contribution of their teachers who are striking. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 21 January 2020, pro-Houthi forces reportedly looted medical equipment from Ibb University (Al Mashannah, Ibb).

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
actor2: Police Forces of Yemen (2012-) Special Security Forces
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project; Crater Sky

No fatalities were reported. *Note that pro-Houthi forces did not claim responsibility for the attack.

On 20 January 2020, in El Ala, residents of Sayada closed the road by burning rubber tires and seized a school bus to demonstrate against water and electricity shortcuts affecting them. [size=no report]

On 20 January, a string of arson attacks were committed at various locations in the Athens area. Several cars, a school bus, a cafe, a bank ATM . No injuries were reported. On 23 January the group Male Comrades/Female Comrades claimed responsibility and expressed their solidarity with members of building occupations in Koukaki.
On Jan 20, an unidentified IED targeted a school in Shatra, causing only material damages.

On 20 January, at least five police personnel were injured when a student mob vandalized a nursing home premises and clashed with police at Chakchaka (Cooch Behar district, West Bengal) following the death of a school student at a private nursing home. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 20 January 2020, a riot of students took place in Mbuji-Mayi against the results of the last university's elections, injuring three persons including a police officer. Some persons were armed. [size=no report].

On 20 Jan. 2020, a group of students demonstrated in Matam area of Conakry city (Matam, Conakry) for being held in their schools while there were no classes due to a teachers' strike. The demonstrators threw stone at the security forces [coded: Police Forces] deployed. No fatality and/or casualty reported. [size=no report]

On 20 Jan. 2020, students demonstrated in several areas of Conakry city (Kaloum, Conakry) to demand the return of their teachers who have stopped classes because of a strike. They threw stones at their schools and tried to disrupt ongoing courses. [size=no report]

On 19 January, a group of young people targeted a Hellenic Police rapid response unit (Amesi Drasi) with rocks, petrol bombs, wooden beams and other objects in central Athens. The police officers were lured by a call reporting a disturbance and when they arrived at the scene, they were attacked by rioters emerging from the Athens University's Law School grounds. There were six detentions. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2020, in Ho Lat Village (coded for Ho Lat (Li Shaw), in Ah Nauk Kin Village Tract, in Namhsan Township, in northern Shan State, a column of Myanmar military entered into the village and fired with small and heavy weapons. During the attack, a monk was injured and some civilian houses including a monastery and schools were damaged.
On January 19, Israeli soldiers stormed a high school in Ramallah, raided the classrooms and assaulted it's students.

On Jan 19, students organized a demonstration that started in front of the Muthanna University building in Samawah city and closed the main gate of the university, then moved to block roads using burning tires in response to the failure to meet the demands of the popular movement. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Iraq); Government of Iraq (2018-); State and Law Coalition
notes: On Jan 19, a number of demonstrators including hundreds of students blocked several roads and intersections in Nassriya city amidst the civil disobedience announced in all the schools and organizations with the exception of the service sector, this is in response to the upcoming 'Nassriya deadline' given by the demonstrators to the government to meet their demands. Demonstrators also burned down the Wafaa party (part of the State and Law Coalition) HQ in the city. 7 demonstrators were injured after an unidentified vehicle opened fire on them. [size=hundreds]

On 18 January, a mob attacked and assaulted an ASI on a school campus in Haroa (North 24 Parganas district, West Bengal) over an alleged molestation of two girl students of a school. The mob also set ablaze two police vehicles and clashed with police who tried to rescue the ASI. [size=no report]
On 18 January, an ASI allegedly tried to molest two female students of a school in Haroa (North 24 Parganas district, West Bengal) when he asked the girls for water in the campus.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On January 18, presumed JNIM or ISGS militants attacked the village of Roffenega, and killed seven people and burned a school.

On 18 January, students of Plus II first year student of BJB Autonomous College staged a road blockade and burned tires in Bhubaneswar (Khordha, Odisha) against the recent decision of the Odisha government, which requires them to secure 33 per cent in the examination to be promoted to second year. [size=no report]

On 17 January, unidentified assailants attacked, with clubs, police officers of the DIAS motorcycle unit outside the Athens University of Economics and Business, leaving them with minor injuries. No arrests were reported. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2020, parents of pupil from the Mpongo Primary School in Macleantown in the Eastern Cape province, demonstrated at the school, demanding transport for their children. Demonstrators barricaded the N6 with burning tyres. [size=no report].

actor2: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
notes: On 16 January 2020, near Kyaung Taung Village, in Kyaung Taung Village Tract, in Rathedaung Township, in Rakhine State, a clash broke out between the Myanmar military and the Arakan Army in Mayu River. AA members attacked the military navy vassal at a mouth of a stream near lower Kyaung Taung village. Stray bullets from the clash hit a monastery and a school in Sa Hpo Kyun.
On 16 January 2020, parents demonstrated in Beaufort West, demanding school transport for their children. Roads were barricaded with burning tyres. [size=no report].

[size=10-15]

assoc_actor_1: FESCI: Student Federation of Ivory Coast; Students (Ivory Coast)
notes: On 15 Jan. 2020, the FESCI students union clashed with another group of students in the high school of Bangolo town (Guemon, Montagnes). Airstrikes resulted in the killing of 1 child and the wounding of 7 other people. The strikes partially damaged the walls of the Ariha Girls School.

source: Al Masdar; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 15 January 2020, pro-Hadi Islah-affiliated soldiers reportedly stormed the headquarters of Taizz axis in Ni'mah Rassam School on Jamal Street, just south of Al-Darbah neighbourhood (Al-Mudhaffar), and broke doors and windows to demand financial aid for the war wounded. No fatalities nor injuries were reported but Taizz governor subsequently left the governorate's capital for Al-Turbah city in Shamayatayn district before urgently disbursing money for the war wounded.

On 14 January, BJP workers attacked two students of Jadavpur University near the Bikramgarh market in Tollygunge in Kolkata (West Bengal) after arguments broke out between the former and students supporting the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 (CAA) movement. [size=no report]

As reported on 14 January 2020, regime forces shelled Ghadqa town in Idleb. Several shells targeted Ghadqa Girls school and Shahid Ahmad Qablan school in Ghadqa partially damaging their buildings and furniture. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

On 14 January 2020, anti-Houthi National Resistance forces reportedly fired machine guns at Hodeidah airport and Hodeidah University in the south of the city in western Yemen (Al-Hawak) with no report of fatalities nor injuries.

On 14 January 2020, anti-Houthi National Resistance forces reportedly fired machine guns at Hodeidah airport and Hodeidah University in the south of the city in western Yemen (Al-Hawak) with no report of fatalities nor injuries.

On 14 Jan. 2020, a group of high school students threw stones at their school in Faranah town (Faranah-Centre, Faranah) as they were demonstrating against a strike of teachers that stopped the classes since about one week. [size=no report]

On Jan 14, demonstrators burned tires and blocked three main highways leading to the Beirut from the south, east and north, bringing traffic to a standstill. School and university students took part in some of the demonstrations and hundreds marched down main highways, raising Lebanese flags and blasting rallying songs through loudspeakers, demanding the formation of a government of independents and decrying financial and banking policies at the start of the 'week of wrath'. Two demonstrators reportedly attempted to set themselves on fire. [size=hundreds]
On January 14 2020, angry parents ejected the principal of Gamba Secondary School in Migori during a demonstraion over poor test results. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2020, students clashed with residents during a demonstration at Ehlanzeni TVET College's Mapulaneng campus, near Bushbuckridge in Mpumalanga after former students gained entrance to the campus to help students register. Students threw stones at police officers. [size=no report].

On January 13 2020, students from Egerton University rioted and clashed with police at the Njoro Campus in Nakuru County after the institution imposed fines on students for damage due to a riot on December 4. [size=no report]

On 13 January, a mob of 70-80 people attacked security guards and damaged hospital property at the Government Medical College Hospital in Aurangabad (Aurangabad, Maharashtra), after a patient died in the ward. [size=70-80]
On Jan 13, crude bombs were thrown at a school bus injuring 2 students, in Allahabad (UP), for reasons unknown. [size=no report]

On 13 January, students of the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki against the education reforms being introduced by the government were demonstrating at the university's administration building demanding to see the Rector, who agreed to see student representatives. When some of the demonstrators attempted to break into the Rector's offices university employees initiated a lock down. [size=no report]
On January 13 2020, a mob tried to lynch a suspected thief who was caught trying to steal from the University of Zambia campus in Lusaka. Police officers intervened. [size=no report]
On January 13 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a school in Kamuthe, Garissa County, killing 3 male teachers and injuring 1 child. They also destroyed a Safaricom communication mast.

On 12 January 2020, unknown gunmen reportedly coming from Nigeria attacked the village of Garantchi Nare, and abducted three Quranic school students.

On 12 January, 2020, clashes between demonstrators and police outside of Wassit university in Kut city, left 8 demonstrators injured, following which demonstrators set ablaze the entrance of the university and threw stones at police forces, injuring a hundred officer. [size=no report]
On 12 January, 2020, an IED was detonated by an unknown armed group, in Rifai city, in Thi-Qar province, targeting a high school. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

On 11 January, students of Savitribai Phule Pune University clashed with police who tried to disperse them in Pune (Pune, Maharashtra) as they demanded increased stipends, permission to work on weekends, and free sweaters. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2020, the UK ambassador to Iran was detained and released after a few hours after attending a vigil for the victims of the downed Ukrainian Airlines plane at the Amirkabir University in Tehran. He insists that he left the vigil after it turned into a protest and was arrested when he was getting a haircut at a barber shop nearby. Iranian officials accused him of helping to organise the demonstrations.
On Jan 10, a school boy was beaten by locals on suspicion of theft in Belka (Sundarganj, Gaibandha). He was accused of stealing a cow. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; Students (South Africa)

Classes at the Durban University of Technology have been disrupted by protesting Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command members (EFFSC) who chased students out of their classes. The protest was said to be in honour of an EFFSC member killed during a violent protest. [size=no report]
18 February. Students from the University of KwaZulu-Natal have burned their mattresses in protest against their bed in their university residence being uncomfortable. [size=no report]

The attack happened in two waves of throwing rocks, Molotov cocktails bombs and other objects. There were no injuries, detentions or arrests reported.

17 February. Buildings and vehicles were burned at the University of Zululand's KwaDlangezwa Campus by rioting students, who demanded answers over their allowances and tuition fees not being paid. Police arrived at the scene, attempting to diffuse the situation. Some injuries have been reported. Size of demonstration unknown.
On Feb 17, activists of BCL beat up a student at Chittagong university, Fatehpur (Hathazari, Chittagong) on suspicion of him being an activist of ICS.
On 17 February, 2019, regime forces shelled the town of Babuline impacting Martyr Omar Al Ulwan School, severely damaging its fence, with no injuries or fatalities reported.

On 17 February, 2019, the regime forces shelled the town of Ma'arrat An Nu'man, targeting civilian areas, houses and a local market known as Al Khudar Market, burning several shops and severely damaging them, with surface to surface missiles, and shells fell near Abdul Karim Ramadan School in al Janoubi neighborhood, partially damaging its fence, and also killed between 1 to 5 civilians and injured 7 others.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Security Belt Forces
notes: Armed clashes reportedly erupted in Bir Ahmed area of Aden port city in southwestern Yemen between the first battalion of Security Belt forces led by Ahmed Al-Bakri Yafa'i and local landowners following an alleged unlawful sell of property to Aden University. No casualties were reported and the Security Belt forces reportedly withdrew.

16 February. Unidentified armed group kidnap over 100 students and some teachers from St. Augustine College in Kumbo of Jakiri, releasing them a day later following negotiations to shut down the school.

admin1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
notes: Mortar attacks launched by unidentified assailants hit an elementary school at Barangay Tanum, Patikul town, Sulu province on February 16, 2019. No one was wounded.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
notes: On February 16, presumed JNIM and/or ISGS militants burned a school in Timambadi (coded as Namounou at geoprecision 2).

On February 16, the house of a first-year student from Calcutta College was vandalized in Birati area in North Dum Dum city (North 24 Parganas, West Bengal), after she made a controversial post on Facebook about the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14. She had ran away from home after threats from neighbours. She was later booked by the police.

actor2: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 16 February, coalition backed Hujur tribal militias reportedly destroyed 2 pro-Houthi armored vehicle in Aflah ash Sham area of Kushar district, northeast of Hajjah border governorate, northwestern Yemen, killing 10 pro-Houthi elements that were on board. Also, they gained control over a checkpoint and a school in Dhira an Nid, in proximity of Aflah ash Sham.

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)
notes: 15 February. More than 100 students rioted at the University of Fort Hare's Alice campus, attacking the police, damaging vehicles and destroying the cafeteria. One police officer was injured. The protest was in response to NSFAS allowances not being paid and tuition and postgraduate registration fee increases. The Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command and the South African Students' Congress led the protests.

On February 15, 2019 in Bar, Montenegro, citizens held a protest over the construction of a kindergarten in the backyard of a high school, which the police dispersed, violently removing a pregnant woman from the site of the protest, after which she lost the baby. Citizens continued the protest in the afternoon, and later in the night, turning it into a protest against police brutality.

On February 15, around 30 students beat up another student from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) inside the college hostel in Durgapur city (Paschim Bardhaman, West Bengal), over a social media post about the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14.
On February 15, IJeT activists allegedly assaulted a student of the Hailey College of Commerce, Punjab University in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab).

On 15 Feb, in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka), three Kashmiri students beat up a fellow collegemate (Koushik Debnath) when the latter questioned their social media (Facebook) post supporting the Pulwama attack in J&K. The 3 were later arrested on charges of assault and spreading of hateful messages on social media.

assoc_actor_1: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa)

Reports of tires burnt and people prevented from entering schools. Workers demand full time employment. Workers said that nine of their members were shot by police.

On Feb. 15 2019, a group called Anarchists damaged several glass panes and desks at the ELTA (post office) branch in the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki campus just after opening time and then fled. They claimed responsibility on Feb. 22 and expressed their solidarity with a jailed robber with suspected ties with urban guerrilla groups, who has been on hunger strike for more than a month.

On Feb 14 2019, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinian students in Hebron City near the Tariq ibn Ziyad school, as Israeli forces stormed the area. Dozens of Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation.
13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.
13 February. Pastoralist militia attacked a Technical Secondary School in Afa, killed one person and abducted a Catholic cleric.
On Feb 13, two armed groups of BCL activists clashed at Jahangirnagar University (Savar, Dhaka) following a previous enmity. Eight people were injured in the clash.

On 13 February, 2019, the regime forces shelled Khan Shaykun in the south-eastern countryside of Idleb near a civil defense center which was established in a cave in al Sharqi neighborhood, and shelled on Martyr Ahmad Al Yousef High School for girls, killing 2 men and wounding 10 others.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

On 12 Feb, BJP members were assaulted by Aligarh Muslim University students in Aligarh (UP) when they were demanding cancellation of a proposed visit of MIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi to the campus. Report indicates the students were from the Muslim community.
12 February. Students from Cape Peninsula University of Technology, Bellville campus, built shacks on the campus and set fire to buses in protest against accommodation shortages.

On Feb 12, in Bonon, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades on the main road. Police Forces clashed with the protesters, and used tear gas. Students reportedly threw stones at them. One police officer was injured.

On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces raided the town of Abu Dis in Al Quds and sealed off roads near Al-Quds University. This triggered clashes with Palestinian youth, to which Israeli forces responded by firing rubber bullets and teargas canisters. At least 17 Palestinians were treated from tear gas inhalation.
On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces detained and assaulted two Palestinian students on their way to school in Jabal al Tawil in Ramallah.

On Feb 12 2019, 17 Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation after Israeli forces stormed the Al-Quds University in Abu Dis while classes were ongoing. Israeli forces also fired stun grenades at the students.

On Feb 11, in the morning, public school students (Nangui Abrogoua highschool, Williamsville highschool, and Harris highschool) attempted to interrupt courses in Djedji Amondji Pierre highschool, throwing stones, bottles and sticks at the students, injuring 3 of them and forcing them to leave their classrooms. They were protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike since three weeks. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas to disperse the rioters.

11 February. The main entrance of the Vaal University of Technology (VUT) was blocked by protesting students over financial exclusion and the non-payment of allowances by the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS). Students also protested at their residences over the shortage of accommodation. Stones and bottles were thrown by student to gain entrance to the residence. Police used rubber bullets to diffuse the riot.

On Feb 11, in Guiglo, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades and destroyed several statues. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas. One student was injured.

On Feb 11, in Botro, a group of highschool students protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike tried to interrupt courses in the Mayor's private school and to force students to leave their classrooms. Police forces clashed with the students and allegedly beat one of them and arrested 11.

On Feb 11, a group of students, protesting against the interruption of public school following a professors' strike, attempted to interrupt courses and force students of Nangui Abrogoua highschool to leave their classrooms, in Abidjan.

On Feb 11, Alepe Modern highschool students protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They threw stones at students from other schools, forcing them to leave their classrooms.

On Feb 11, in Soubre, students from several highschools protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They interrupted courses in Charles Bauza Donwahi private highschool, Modern 1 private highschool, Modern 2 private highschool and Bernard Zadi Zaourou private highschool, forcing the students to leave their classrooms.

On Feb. 11, 2019: Students from the Law Faculty in Tirana, who stayed barricaded in their university until this day, said they were ending their boycott, thus allowing the teaching process to take place. One of the students explained that the decision was taken because exams were approaching and they did not want to lose the academic year. Other students said the group will continue to seek education reform.

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; Students (South Africa)

On February 11, students from Mission Blind School, Heikakpokpi, blocked the Imphal-Moreh highway by putting benches across it, at Heikakpokpi village (Chandel, Manipur). They claimed the school was not getting any assistance from the State Government.

On 11 Feb, GGM Science College students clashed with Kashmiri passengers stranded by road closures in Jammu city (J&K). The clash occurred after some Kashmiri passengers raised pro-Pakistan slogans over the administrations failure to airlift them to Srinagar. Police intervened with a lathicharge against the students.

On Feb 5, four activists were injured when rioting factions of BCL clashed at Chattogram College in Chittagong city over establishing supremacy at campus.

On Feb. 5. 2019: Students from the Faculty of Law in Tirana continued their barricades inside the University, not letting classes continue and demanding education reform to be initiated by government.

notes: Pro-Houthi forces reportedly blew up Al-Nour School in Al-Mija'ar area of Tuhayta district, south of Hodeidah governorate in western Yemen, with no report of casualties. This is reportedly the third school destroyed by pro-Houthi forces in the district.

28 January. Lubumbashi University students continued their demonstrations over access to water and electricity on campus, as well as university fees. They barricaded roads, blocked access to the university, and burned tires.
28 January. Students of the Institute of Superior Pedagogy (ISP) in Bukavu demonstrated against school and syllabus fees. The students burned tires and barricaded roads.
On Jan 27, BCL activists attacked some students at a college function at Tengorpara High School in Sreebardi upazila (Sherpur, Mymensingh). Four students were injured in the attack.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 27 January. Students from the University of Lubumbashi demonstrated over water, electricity, and fees. The demonstrators barricaded roads, blocked access to the university, and burned tires and vehicles. Police forces opened fire on the demonstrators, killing three. A police officer also died after being hit by a police car.

On January 26, students at a university in NDjamena barricaded offices and prevented access to teachers, a security officer fired gunshots and threw a grenade, wounding several students including one severely.

On January 26, a journalist was beaten up inside a cinema hall in Bhubaneswar city (Khordha, Odisha), for opposing a group of Utkal University students who were passing vulgar remarks on women. The journalist sustained multiple injuries and was admitted to the hospital, and discharged on the same day after treatment.
On Jan 26, two activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured during a factional clash at Chittagong University (Chittagong city) over establishing supremacy on the campus.

source: AMNA; To Pontiki; Ekathimerini; Greek Reporter
notes: On Jan. 25 2019, unidentified perpetrators smashed the marble plaques in the campus of the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki commemorating a Jewish cemetery destroyed by the Nazis. The attack happened ahead of the events planned for International Holocaust Remembrance Day on Jan. 27. This is the third time the monument has been targeted in a short time. The Rectorate of the University, the Central Israeli Council of Greece and the German Consul in Thessaloniki condemned the attack.

25 January. 5 students are abducted from a secondary school near Natcho in Bamenda by an unidentified armed group, Cameroon government officials and Ambazonian separatists blame each other for the ongoing abductions.

On 25 January, a group of 300 unemployed teachers staged a demonstration march in Amritsar city (Amritsar, Punjab) and attempted to deliver a memo to the state Education Minister at his home, demanding appointments at government schools. Police cane charged the teachers when they refused to stop on orders and attempted to remove barricades - at least 4 demonstrators and one officer were injured in the clash.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On Jan. 24 2019, after the demonstrations against the Prespes deal in Thessaloniki, a group of about 80 far-right rioters attacked the building of the occupation "Free Social Space Scholeio" with torches, flares and petrol bombs but they were pushed back by members of the occupation safeguarding the building, so they moved on to the University Student Club, where they were dispersed by riot police.
On January 24, students in Sikasso attempted to launch an assault against an academy and private schools they also threw stones against security forces who dispersed the protesters by firing teargas.

24 January. Members of the community of Boikhutsong near Ventersdorp barricaded the R30 road with burning tyres and stoned passing vehicles stoned asking for a meeting with delegates of the department of education over schools and school transport.
On 23 January 2019, classes were suspended and students held protests and threw stones at their schools in Sijoumi and Douar Hicher.
23 January. A teacher at Polytechnic school is abducted in Bambui by 3 from an unidentified armed group.

Assumed on January 23, in Kolhapur town (Kolhapur, Maha), 20 members of the youth wing of Shiv Sena rioted and vandalized the Holy Cross Convent High School because parents were asked for an additional Rs 7,000 for each student in the junior kindergarten.

assoc_actor_1: DYFI: Democratic Youth Federation of India
notes: On January 23, in Thiruvananthapuram town (Thiruvananthapuram, TN), DYFI members clashed with police during a violent demonstration when they were refused permission to visit two youths who were arrested by the Medical College police for sexual harassment of a minor girl.

On January 23, a clash between RSS and Muslims took place at a high school ground in Ward-12 in Kendrapara city (Kendrapara, Odisha), during a cultural event on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. A few persons sustained injuries during the clash. Police personnel were deployed to control the situation.
On 23 January 2019, classes were suspended and students held protests and threw stones at their schools in Sijoumi and Douar Hicher.

On Jan 23, students of Syed Nazrul Islam College in Mymensingh vandalized a police station in the city, retaliating to the physical assault of one of the college teachers by a police constable. Police fired rubber bullets to disperse the demonstrators.

On Jan 23, 2019, a group of students held a demonstration in Babussalam district, Southeast Aceh Regency, Aceh province, criticizing the university's management performance. They engaged in a brawl with the police. They destroyed the gate of Southeast Aceh regent's office building. [size=no report]

On Jan 23, a number of Khader High School students suffered from tear gas fired by Israeli soldiers into its yard. The attack led to suffocation of several students and caused the school to be evacuated.

On January 22, a mob assaulted a pharmacist outside Jhanji Girls' High School in Jhanji village in Gaurisagar area (Sivasagar, Assam), after he was accused of sexually harassing three girls students during an eye check-up under the Rashtriya Bal Swastha Sewa Scheme.
On or aroud 22 January 2019, as part of student protests against the crisis in the education sector, students in Fouchana threw stones at their school and fled as soon as police arrived.

actor1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Khasadar Force
notes: On January 22, a Khasadar shot and injured a private college student in Bara Qambarkhel area of Bara tehsil (tehsil capital coded) (Bara, Khyber, KP).

On Jan 22, a college teacher was assaulted by policemen near Mymensingh Zila School Intersection in the Mymensingh town (Mymensingh). The incident happened following an altercation over a minor accident.
On Jan 22, forty people were injured in a clash between two groups over formation of a management committee at a school in Baniachong (Habiganj, Sylhet).

21 January. Students riot in several areas of Mamou city over planned examinations, destroying property at a private school and clashing with police by throwing stones. Police disperse the students with tear gas and some injuries were reported after police beat students on school property.

On Jan. 21, 2019: Students from Luigi Gurakuqi University in Shkoder continued their barricades inside the faculties to demand education reform and said they would not open the university until their requests would be met.

On 20 Jan, in Kolhapur city (Kolhapur, Maha), around 20 men from the Yuva Sena, the youth wing of the Shiv Sena, ransacked the school principal's office of the Holy Cross Convent High School after parents were asked for an additional Rs 7,000 per student in the junior kindergarten as building fund. 15 people were arrested.

On January 20, election agents of political parties and candidates vandalized furniture at Don Bosco School in Haflong city (Dima Hasao, Assam), alleging rigging of votes by supporters of the ruling BJP during North Cachar Hills Autonomous Council elections. A LED display of CCTVs installed outside the strong room had been switched off, fuelling fear of rigging. The police intervened to control the mob.
On Jan 20, unidentfied group of men attacked a top-level leader of BCL at Rajshahi university in Rajshahi district and sevrerly injured him after stabbing.
On January 20, a number of flexes and flags of Trinamool Congress were damaged by unidentified men inside the Jadavpur University campus near gate number 4, in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal).
19 January. Al Shabaab has allegedly abducted dozens of school children near Tiyeglow town, Bakool.

On 19 January 2019, four assailants punched and kicked a well-known activist near Thammasat University in Bangkok city, after he was returning from a protest demanding that the government should hold elections without further delays.

actor2: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 19 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired artillery at a pro-Houthi position in Al Rawd school in At Tayziyyah district, west of Taizz city, central Yemen, killing 9 pro-Houthi fighters including commanders.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On Jan. 19 2019 since before midnight and until 2 a.m., a group of hooded people targeted the MAT riot police units that are stationed outside the National Technical University of Athens (Polytechnio) throwing Molotov cocktails bombs. There were no injuries, detentions or arrests reported.

On January 18, locals blocked the road with stones and burnt materials in Pirukudi under Khajuripada police limits area (Kandhamal, Odisha), after a JCB excavator ran over two school students killing them on the spot. The locals demanded compensation for the families of the deceased and arrest of the JCB driver.

As reported on January 18, 2019 in Vukovar, Croatia, a Serbian high-school student was attacked by a group for 'not standing up when the Croatian anthem is playing', causing discussion in the media and among politicians in Serbia and Croatia.

On 18 January 2019, students at the preparatory school in Kondar refused to enter the school and demanded to take the exams. Some of them deliberately attempted to attack the educational institution which led to the dispatch of a security patrol to protect it.

On January 18, students from Islamia College Civil Lines clashed with a traffic police official and later staged a demonstration by blocking the road outside the office of the Chief Traffic Officer in Data Gunj Buksh town (Karachi, Sindh), against alleged misbehaviour of the traffic warden.

actor2: NAF: United Armed Forces of Novorossiya
notes: On 17 January 2019, a building of a functioning school was damaged by small arms fire due to an armed clash between the Military Forces of Ukraine and NAF rebel forces in Zolote-5, Luhansk. The OSCE SMM observed a total of 2 projectiles involving unknown weapons near Zolote-5.

notes: On 17 January, pro-Houthi forces reportedly fired mortar shells at Hays city, southeast of Zabid city, western Yemen, hitting the hospital a school and civilian houses, causing material damages. No casualties reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On January 17, presumed Katiba Macina militants chased away the teachers and ransacked a school in Attara.
On Jan. 17, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded in the Polytechnic University in Tirana, disrupting lectures until their demands would be fulfilled.
17 January. A school teacher was shot and wounded in Mogadishu by unknown assailants. The perpatrators escaped.

On Jan. 16, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded in the Aleksander Xhuvani University in Elbasan. Students said they were threatened by professors to receive absense notes unless they returned to lectures, which violated the Dean's order.
On Jan. 16, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded in the Polytechnic University in Tirana, disrupting lectures until their demands would be fulfilled.
16 January. Unidentified armed group attack a school in Limbe of Fako. Coded as VAC pending more information.

On Jan 16, at least two activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured when two rioting factions clashed over establishing supremacy at Manikganj Government Devendra College campus in Manikganj, Dhaka.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a school director in Gasenyi until a ransom was paid.
In the middle of the week starting on 13 January 2019, a group of protesters in Kamour closed the road and burned tires to demand a elementary school in the town.
Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired heavy and medium weapons toward Hodeidah University in the south of the city, western Yemen, with no report of casualties.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of United States; QSD: Syrian Democratic Forces; Menbij Military Council; Civilians (Syria); Teachers (Syria)
notes: On January 16, 2019, an IS female suicide operative detonated herself in the vicinity of al-Omara restaurant in Menbij city in eastern Aleppo countryside, killing 4 U.S. military members along with 5 of their escorts including members of Menbij Military Council, in addition to killing between 5 to 10 civilians, including 2 children and the Um Jloud school manager, and wounding several others. Total fatalities coded to 15, with 1 fatality for the suicide bomber.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: A police officer severely beat a child in front of Saba Private Highschool because the child quarreled with the officers son.
On Jan. 15, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded and boycotting lectures in their university in Durres until their demands would be fulfilled.
On Jan. 15, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded and boycotting lectures in their university in Elbasan until their demands would be fulfilled.
On Jan. 15, 2019: Students continued demonstrating for educational reform by staying barricaded and boycotting lectures in their university in Tirana until their demands would be fulfilled.

Within the month of Jan, in Munnad area (Kasaragod, Kerala), a group of Congress workers assaulted a CPM worker (Peethambaran) in connection with the issues at the People's Co-Operative Arts and Science College. No other information was provided. Other sources cited it happened on the first week of Feb.

On 14 January, the former rector of a Kyiv medical university and her supporters demonstrated outside the administrative building of the university in Kyiv against her suspension. They broke into the university building and caused a fight. The police escorted the demonstrators outside. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Greece); Students (Greece); DOE: Primary Teachers Union; OLME: Greek Federation of Secondary Education State School Teachers; ADEDY: Civil Servants Confederation; Labour Group (Greece)
actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
source: AP; AFP; Greek Reporter; To Vima
notes: On Jan. 14 2019, about 2,000 secondary school teachers and school and university students took part in a rally organised by the primary and secondary school teachers' federations DOE and OLME, as well as the civil servants' ADEDY, to demonstrate against reforms to the way they are appointed at state schools. Workers in municipalities who lack job security also demonstrated with the teachers. Traffic in central Athens was disrupted. When dozens to hundreds of demonstrators tried to break through a police cordon attacking officers, riot police used tear gas and stun grenades to disperse them. No injuries or arrests were reported.
On Jan 14 in the evening and Jan 15 in the morning, in Saint Louis, students from Gaston Berger University blocked the National Road 2, to protest against the delay of scholarships payment.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); AJYCP: Asom Jatiyatabadi Yuva Chatra Parishad; AGP: Asom Gana Parishad; INC: Indian National Congress
notes: On January 13, students of Bajali College along with many other students of private schools, with the support of AGP, AJYCP and Congress members, burnt tyres and damaged banners in front of the BJP office in Pathsala city (Barpeta, Assam), against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Houthi forces' ballistic missiles targeted areas near Al-Hudaydah University of Al Hali district in Al Hudaydah governorate.

notes: On 12 Jan 2019, in tambon Talorkapor (Yaring, Pattani), a five hours clash took place between the police and suspected southern separatist allegedly linked with the school shooting on 10 Jan 2019. Two separatists were killed. A volunteer ranger and an eight-year-old child were slightly injured.
On 12 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired 6 mortar shells toward the University in Al Hali district of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen. No casualties reported.

source: Al Masirah; Ansar Allah; Yemen Data Project
notes: On 11 January, anti-Houthi forces reportedly targeted with mortar shells civilian houses near the Scientific University in Al Hawak district, in the western part of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen, injuring 3 civilians.

source: Ekathimerini; To Vima; AMNA; The National Herald
notes: On Jan. 11 2019, about 1,500 secondary school teachers and university students took part in a rally organised by the primary and secondary school teachers' federations DOE and OLME, as well as the civil servants' ADEDY, with the intent to march to Maximos Mansion and meet with the Prime Minister to demonstrate against reforms to the way they are appointed at state schools. A few dozen demonstrators tried to force their way into Parliament; riot police fired tear gas to stop them and two people were injured by stun grenades. No arrests were reported.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
source: I Avgi; AMNA; To Vima; Ekathimerini
notes: On Jan. 11 2019, a group of 20 to 50 unidentified assailants attacked riot police with stones and other projectiles outside the Athens University of Economics and Business. The policemen were there to crack down on illegal vendors operating in the area when the police van was attacked and the driver was injured in his arm when hooded assailants came at him with clubs and hammers. He fired warning shots to disperse the attackers. 3 to 11 people were detained.

10 January. Armed Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Kumba of the South West region near a local school, wounding three soldiers and killing and wounding "several" seperatists. "Several" killed and wounded coded as 10.

assoc_actor_1: SLECG: Free Union of Teachers and Researchers of Guinea; Labour Group (Guinea)
notes: 10 January. SLECG and government negotiations fail over salary discussions, leading to riots in Labe with stones thrown at schools and other students. Police intervene to disperse the rioters.

On January 10th, armed men attacked a truck carrying provisions the Dr John Garang University, in the area of Bed-Laku near Mangalla (Central Equatoria). A police officer who was accompanying the truck exchanged fire with the attackers, and was wounded in the process. The officer is to be taken to Juba for treatment.

On 10 Jan, two factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) at Jagannath University (JnU) in Dhaka city clashed, leaving at least ten of their activists injured. Posts on Facebook and establishing supremacy were the reasons behind the clash.

actor2: Military Forces of Thailand (2014-) Volunteer Defense Corps
notes: On 10 Jan 2019, in tambon Prachan (Yarang, Pattani) about eight armed men dressed like soldiers (suspected separatists) opened fire on defence volunteers at Bukoh school. Four defence volunteers were killed.

On Jan. 9, 2019: Albanian students barricaded themselves at the Polytechnic University in Tirana and demonstrated, demanding education reform. While some students tried to move chairs and tables out of the university, they clashed with university guards. No injuries were reported.

On 09 January, 2019, National Army of opposition shelled with mortar the town of Atmah in Idleb countryside, which impacted Abnaa Al Sham school, partially damaging its building. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.
On January 9, unidentified people threw rocks at a college van and shattered the windows injuring some students inside the van, in Kasur town (Kasur, Punjab).

On 8 January, chaos erupted at the University of South Africa (Unisa) Pietermaritzburg campus as protesting students blocked off a street by burning tyres, calling on management to address their demands.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
notes: On 8 January, a group of around 10 labour activists stopped a school bus and attacked the bus driver by Champadali crossing in Barasat area of Delhi (Delhi) for not following the national two day labour strike against BJP policies. The man was rescued by nearby civilians. The strike was called by several groups including the CITU, INTUC, AITUC, HMS, AITUC and CPI-M.

On 8 Jan 2019, in Ban Pong Sakhor in tambon Moh Mawee (Yarang, Pattani), a bomb detonated in front of a local non-formal education center. It is suspected that it was planted by Southern Muslim Separatists. A private and a 12-year-old schoolgirl were injured.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
source: Telegraph (India); Afternoon Voice (India); Indo-Asian News Service
notes: On January 8, a school bus was stone pelted in Champadali area of Barasat city (North 24 Parganas, West Bengal), during the two day nationwide strike called by the central unions, including the CITU, INTUC, AITUC, HMS, AITUC and CPI-M, against the BJP-government policies. There was also a clash with the police in the railway station, and clashes with TMC supporters.

On 7 Jan 2019, a military court sentenced two Al Shabaab militants to death after finding them guilty of killing a male clan elder who was an electoral delegate in 2016. The two AS militants were executed at the police school public square at Hamar Weyne district, Mogadishu.
On 6 January, Bathembu High School in uMzinyathi district in Msinga, northern KZN, were damaged in suspected arson attacks.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019); Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces; Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Sudan); PCP: Popular Congress Party; Teachers (Sudan)
notes: During the week beginning January 6th, numerous arrests were made by security services in the midst of nation-wide demonstrations, with the Interior Minister stating on Jan 7th that 817 had been arrested (the opposition NUP has provided a figure of around 2,000). In addition to various post-demonstration arrests, 20 professors from the University of Khartoum and 3 journalists were arrested in Khartoum (coordinates used) on Jan 6th; an MP with the PCP was reportedly detained on Jan 9th, after she participated in a demonstration in Omdurman. Elewhere, an activist was rearrested in El Gedaref on January 8th, prompting a social media campaign calling for his release, whilst a nurse (who is also an activist) was arrested in El Obeid on Jan 9th.

On January 6, two groups of students clashed in Garamur area in Jorhat city (Jorhat, Assam), when a group of boys from an adjacent village started to play cricket inside the Jorhat Engineering College campus. Two persons were injured.
On 6 January, Mvuzo High School in France township in Pietermaritzburg were damaged in suspected arson attacks.
Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns in the direction of the Hudaydah airport, Al Shabaab park, and College of Medicine. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns in the direction of the Hudaydah airport and College of Medicine. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On January 4, students of SM College demonstrated by pelting stones at the college building in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) against the college administration for not issuing admit card for their annual exams.

On 4 January 2019, some parents residing in Borj Al Aifa continued and escalated their protest by placing barricades and burning tires on road No. 5 in an attempt to put pressure on the authorities not to close a school in the area.
On January 4, a school teacher was beaten up by the locals after he was caught with a married woman in her house, in No.1 Bhelkara village in Hajo city area (Kamrup, Assam).

actor1: NSUI: National Students Union of India
notes: On 4 January, the state INSO president was attacked and injured a local youth apparently aligned with the NSUI, at Maharshi Dayanand University in Rohtak city (Rohtak, Haryana). The incident seems to have stemmed from an earlier clash between NSUI and INSO members (no details). The INSO leader was attacked with sharp weapons and lathis, as well as alleging gun shots. No details of the original clash recorded.

Around 4 January, police and farmers clashed after farmers locked a group of stray cattle up in a school in Bidhnu area of Kanpur (Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh), leaving 3 officers injured. No further details.
03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.
On Jan 3, Israeli soldiers opened live fire and fired tear gas at Palestinian students who were leaving their school in Tell near Nablus. The reason for the attack on the students is unknown.
Week of 02 January. A school principal in Bamenyam of Galim district is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists. He was released hours later.
02 January: Dembi Dolo University president, Dr. Delasa Bulcha was kidnapped by unidentified armed group near Addis Ababa.

On Jan 2, Israeli forces raided a Palestinian school in the West Bank town of Tuqu near Bethlehem. Israeli soldiers fired rubber bullets, teargas and stun grenades during the raid on the school resulting in the temporary asphyxiation of some students from teargas. The reason for the raid remains unknown.
On Jan 2, Jubo League men beat up a BNP activist and teacher (Shafiqul Islam) at Tanore Kolma High School and vandalised his motorcycle in Tanore (Rajshahi).
On January 1, unidentified armed men shot dead a watchman of a government school in Janikhel town (Bannu, KP).

On January 1, in Kozhikode town (Kozhikode, Kerala), Congress activists staged a protest march to the office of the Deputy Director of Education (DDE) in protest against the half-day off declared for schools that they asserted was for mobilizing people for the government-backed women's wall. Congress workers had a minor clash with the police outside the DDE office when they tried to barge into the officials' cabin.
